question_stem: A particle moves along a straight line. Its displacement, \(s\) metres, from a fixed point O at time \(t\) seconds, is given by \(s = 2t^2 - 11t + 12\).

parts.question_text: Find the set of values of \(t\) for which the particle is more than 3 metres away from O.
parts.solution_text: We are looking for the values of \(t\) for which \(s > 3\), so \(2t^2 - 11t + 12 > 3\).  Rearranging gives \(2t^2 - 11t + 9 > 0\).  We first solve the quadratic equation \(2t^2 - 11t + 9 = 0\). This factors as \((2t - 9)(t - 1) = 0\), giving \(t = \frac{9}{2}\) and \(t = 1\). Since the quadratic has a positive coefficient of \(t^2\), the inequality \(2t^2 - 11t + 9 > 0\) is satisfied when \(t < 1\) or \(t > \frac{9}{2}\). Since time must be positive, the set of values of \(t\) for which the particle is more than 3 metres away from O is \(0 < t < 1\) and \(t > \frac{9}{2}\).
